Pages.Name: prop_dynamic
Pages.Description: A prop that can be placed in hierarchy and can play animations and/or simulate cloth. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_physics (i.e. it should be physically simulated) then it CANNOT be used as a prop_dynamic. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_physics instead.

Properties.Description: Range at which the glow becomes visible. (0 = always visible)
Range at which the glow stops being visible. (0 = always visible)
Change the render color of the glow.
Change the team we glow for.
Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'.
The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode.
The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.
Distance at which the overlay starts to fade (-1 = subtract from fademaxdist).
Maximum distance at which the overlay is visible (0 = don't fade out).
Modifies culling behaviour when the object is small / distant
If true, this geometry renders into baked cube maps
Determines if this geometry be considered static & cast shadows/bounce light when baking lightmaps?
Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.
Name(s) of script files that are executed after all entities have spawned.
The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.
Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons.

Options.Name: Set to Local-Nav Ignore (NPC will not try to avoid this entity)
Debris - Don't collide with the player or other debris
Prevent motion enable on player bump

Properties.Description: Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).
Radial force applied to our pieces when we break.
Location in local space where the burst force is applied.
Set the type of contents inside this breakable.
Prop Group to use when the prop is broken
Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins.
Used to disable shadow casting from this entity.
Will add an additional attribute that AI/player entities can query when checking props for information (ex: 'DogToy' or 'GrabbableResource')
Will add this modifier when the entity spawns.

Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.
The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent.

The name of the bone or attachment to attach to on the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Use !bonemerge to use bone-merge style attachment. NOTE: If this is specified the Hammer transform will be disregarded, even if 'Use Local Transform' is NOT specified (in that case local transform will be identity)
Whether to respect the specified local offset when doing the initial hierarchical attachment to its parent.
Offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Angular offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Scale in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Allow the model to use its animgraph it has one. If the model has no animgraph this setting has no effect and is disabled

The name of a starting animation that this prop will start with when it spawns. After completion, it will switch to the Idle sequence, if it is specified. This setting is ignored for models with an animgraph when Use Animgraph is enabled.
The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation. This setting is ignored for models with an animgraph when Use Animgraph is enabled.
If set, this prop will randomize its cycle when it begins animating. Use this to desynchronize animating props that use the same model.
Enable to lag compensate this prop, should be use very sparingly!
Enable this to animate on the server in multiplayer games, such as for props with triggers parented to attachment points. Use sparingly as there is a performance cost.
comma-separated list of interaction layers to interact as
comma-separated list of interaction layers to interact with
comma-separated list of interaction layers to not collide with
Select an entity to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.
Create a navigation obstacle to assist NPC pathfinding
If set, NPC movement will ignore this prop
Cloth scale (stretch) relative to model scale. Use to stretch (not scale) the model, e.g. to reuse a single rope model when different lengths of the rope needed.

InputOutputs.Name: Enable
InputOutputs.Description: Enable this entity.

InputOutputs.Name: Disable
InputOutputs.Description: Disable this entity.

InputOutputs.Name: StartGlowing
InputOutputs.Description: Turn on a permanent glow effect for this prop.

InputOutputs.Name: StopGlowing
InputOutputs.Description: Turn off this prop's glow effect.

InputOutputs.Name: Alpha
InputOutputs.Description: Set the sprite's alpha (0 - 255).

InputOutputs.Name: Color
InputOutputs.Description: Set the sprite's color (R G B).

InputOutputs.Name: SetDamageFilter
InputOutputs.Description: Sets the entity to use as damage filter. Pass in an empty string to clear the damage filter.

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptFile
InputOutputs.Description: Load and execute a script file

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptCode
InputOutputs.Description: Execute a fragment of script code

InputOutputs.Name: CallScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Call a script function

InputOutputs.Name: CallPrivateScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function from this entity's private script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: CallGlobalScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function in the global script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: Kill
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillHierarchy
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillConstrained
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity, all its children, and anything constrained to it, from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: AddOutput
InputOutputs.Description: Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity. Parameter format: outputname>targetname>inputname>parameter>delay>max times to fire (-1 == infinite). Very dangerous, use with care.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnKilled
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the entity is killed and removed from the game. Parameter is the inflictor.

InputOutputs.Name: Break
InputOutputs.Description: Breaks the breakable.

InputOutputs.Name: SetHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Sets a new value for the breakable's health. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: AddHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Adds health to the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: RemoveHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Removes health from the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: SetMass
InputOutputs.Description: Set mass of this object.

InputOutputs.Name: OnStartDeath
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop has begun dying (breaking) before other death-related callbacks.

InputOutputs.Name: OnBreak
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this breakable breaks.

InputOutputs.Name: OnHealthChanged
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the health of this breakable changes, passing the new value of health as a percentage of max health, from [0..1].

InputOutputs.Name: OnTakeDamage
InputOutputs.Description: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

InputOutputs.Name: Skin
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the model skin to the specified number.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow off.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow on.

InputOutputs.Name: AlternativeSorting
InputOutputs.Description: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

InputOutputs.Name: SetRenderAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Set the value of a render attribute used in material dynamic expressions. Examples: $myfloat=0.25 $myfloat4=1.0,0.0,1.0,1.0

InputOutputs.Name: ClearRenderAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Remove a render attribute previously set by SetRenderAttribute, restoring it to its previous value.

InputOutputs.Name: OnIgnite
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this object catches fire.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParent
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachment
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

InputOutputs.Name: ClearParent
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

InputOutputs.Name: FollowEntity
InputOutputs.Description: Bone merges this entity to a parent entity. Call again passing nothing to end the bone merge.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to loop. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationNoResetLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to loop unless the prop is already playing the animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetIdleAnimationLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the Idle Animation to the one specified in the parameter and force it to loop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationNotLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to not loop. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationNoResetNotLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to not loop unless the prop is already playing the animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetIdleAnimationNotLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the Idle Animation to the one specified in the parameter and force it to not loop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetPlaybackRate
InputOutputs.Description: Set the playback rate for the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetBodyGroup
InputOutputs.Description: Sets bodygroup. Format is <BodygroupName,index>

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOn
InputOutputs.Description: Make the prop visible.

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOff
InputOutputs.Description: Make the prop invisible.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableCollision
InputOutputs.Description: Enable collision on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableCollision
InputOutputs.Description: Disable collision on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetNavIgnore
InputOutputs.Description: Enable and disable NAVIgnore on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimGraphParameter
InputOutputs.Description: Set an animation graph parameter Format: <name=value>

InputOutputs.Name: SetRagdollProfile
InputOutputs.Description: Sets the active ragdoll profile.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationBegun
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a new animation has begun playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationDone
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever an animation is complete.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationReachedEnd
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a non-looping animation playing forward hits the end (cycle=1).

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationReachedStart
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a non-looping animation playing backward hits the beginning (cycle=0).

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationLoopCycleDone
InputOutputs.Description: Fires off an event when the current cycle of a looped animation is complete.

Pages.Name: prop_dynamic
Pages.Description: A prop that can be placed in hierarchy and can play animations and/or simulate cloth. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_physics (i.e. it should be physically simulated) then it CANNOT be used as a prop_dynamic. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_physics instead.

Properties.Description: Range at which the glow becomes visible. (0 = always visible)
Range at which the glow stops being visible. (0 = always visible)
Change the render color of the glow.
Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'.
The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode.
The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.
Will only be lit by lights affecting this group.
Distance at which the overlay starts to fade (<0 = subtract from fademaxdist).
Maximum distance at which the overlay is visible (0 = don't fade out).

If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, or if the engine is running under low end/medium end/XBox360, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified. This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.
If true, this geometry renders into baked cube maps
How this geometry influences baked lighting.
Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.
Name(s) of script files that are executed after all entities have spawned.
The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.
Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons.

Options.Name: Debris - Don't collide with the player or other debris
Enable motion on Physcannon grab (This also applies to the HLVR hand interaction)
Prevent motion enable on player bump
Physgun can ALWAYS pick up. No matter what.

Properties.Description: Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).
Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins.
Used to disable dynamic shadows on this entity.

Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.
The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent.
The name of the bone or attachment to attach to on the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Use !bonemerge to use bone-merge style attachment.
Offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Angular offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Scale in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Whether to respect the specified local offset when doing the initial hierarchical attachment to its parent.
The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation.

If set, this prop will randomly choose and play animations, based upon the times specified in 'Min/Max Random Anim Time'. Inbetween the random animations, it will revert to playing the 'Default Animation'.
If set, the prop will not loop its animation, but hold the last frame.
If set, this prop will randomize its cycle when it begins animating. Use this to desynchronize animating props that use the same model.
Minimum time between random animations.
Maximum time between random animations.
Enable to lag compensate this prop, should be use very sparingly!
Enable this to animate on the server in multiplayer games, such as for props with triggers parented to attachment points. Use sparingly as there is a performance cost.
Set this to allow vscript code to move the prop via SetVelocity() calls.
Only used if Scripted Movement is set, sets an initial linear velocity for the entity.
Only used if Scripted Movement is set, sets an initial rotational velocity for the entity.
Select an entity to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.
Update touches for any children that are attached to attachment points as this prop animates. This allows SetParentAttached triggers or func_brushes to touch properly.
Allow this entity to use its animgraph
Create a navigation obstacle to assist NPC pathfinding
If set, NPC movement will ignore this prop
Cloth scale (stretch) relative to model scale. Use to stretch (not scale) the model, e.g. to reuse a single rope model when different lengths of the rope needed.
For windows and doors and other dynamic things that straddle lighting volume boundaries - bias the lighting origin toward whichever side the local player is on

InputOutputs.Name: Enable
InputOutputs.Description: Enable this entity.

InputOutputs.Name: Disable
InputOutputs.Description: Disable this entity.

InputOutputs.Description: Sets the entity to use as damage filter. Pass in an empty string to clear the damage filter.

InputOutputs.Name: CallPrivateScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function from this entity's private script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: CallGlobalScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function in the global script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: Kill
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillHierarchy
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: AddOutput
InputOutputs.Description: Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity. Parameter format: outputname>targetname>inputname>parameter>delay>max times to fire (-1 == infinite). Very dangerous, use with care.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnKilled
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the entity is killed and removed from the game.

InputOutputs.Name: Break
InputOutputs.Description: Breaks the breakable.

InputOutputs.Name: SetHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Sets a new value for the breakable's health. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: AddHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Adds health to the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: RemoveHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Removes health from the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: SetMass
InputOutputs.Description: Set mass of this object.

InputOutputs.Name: OnBreak
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this breakable breaks.

InputOutputs.Name: OnHealthChanged
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the health of this breakable changes, passing the new value of health as a percentage of max health, from [0..1].

InputOutputs.Name: EnablePhyscannonPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Makes the breakable able to picked up by the physcannon.

InputOutputs.Name: DisablePhyscannonPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Makes the breakable not able to picked up by the physcannon.

InputOutputs.Name: OnTakeDamage
InputOutputs.Description: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonDetach
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the physcannon has ripped this breakable off of the wall. Only fired if ACT_PHYSCANNON_DETACH is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePreStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the Pre physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_PRE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePullStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre pull anim, this will be fired after the Pre anim has finished playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonPullAnimFinished
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop has finished playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre & Post pull anims, this will be fired after the Post anim has finished playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePostStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the Post physcannon-pull activity. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_POST activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: Skin
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the model skin to the specified number.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow off.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow on.

InputOutputs.Name: AlternativeSorting
InputOutputs.Description: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

InputOutputs.Name: SetRenderAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Set the value of a render attribute used in material dynamic expressions. Examples: $myfloat=0.25 $myfloat4=1.0,0.0,1.0,1.0

InputOutputs.Name: OnIgnite
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this object catches fire.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParent
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachment
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

InputOutputs.Name: ClearParent
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimation
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationNoReset
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation unless the prop is already playing the animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationTransition
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation. The second animation is the name of the animation it's transitioning from. If that one is still playing it'll just reverse from the current frame.

InputOutputs.Name: SetDefaultAnimation
InputOutputs.Description: Set the Default Animation to the one specified in the parameter.

InputOutputs.Name: SetPlaybackRate
InputOutputs.Description: Set the playback rate for the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetBodyGroup
InputOutputs.Description: Sets bodygroup. Format is <BodygroupName,index>

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOn
InputOutputs.Description: Make the prop visible.

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOff
InputOutputs.Description: Make the prop invisible.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableCollision
InputOutputs.Description: Enable collision on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableCollision
InputOutputs.Description: Disable collision on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetNavIgnore
InputOutputs.Description: Enable and disable NAVIgnore on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimGraphParameter
InputOutputs.Description: Set an animation graph parameter Format: <name=value>

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationBegun
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a new animation has begun playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationDone
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever an animation is complete.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationReachedEnd
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a non-looping animation playing forward hits the end (cycle=1).

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationReachedStart
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a non-looping animation playing backward hits the beginning (cycle=0).

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationLoopCycleDone
InputOutputs.Description: Fires off an event when the current cycle of a looped animation is complete.

Offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Angular offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Scale in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Allow the model to use its animgraph it has one. If the model has no animgraph this setting has no effect and is disabled

The name of a starting animation that this prop will start with when it spawns. After completion, it will switch to the Idle sequence, if it is specified. This setting is ignored for models with an animgraph when Use Animgraph is enabled.
The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation. This setting is ignored for models with an animgraph when Use Animgraph is enabled.
If set, this prop will randomize its cycle when it begins animating. Use this to desynchronize animating props that use the same model.
Enable to lag compensate this prop, should be use very sparingly!
Enable this to animate on the server in multiplayer games, such as for props with triggers parented to attachment points. Use sparingly as there is a performance cost.
comma-separated list of interaction layers to interact as
comma-separated list of interaction layers to interact with
comma-separated list of interaction layers to not collide with
Select an entity to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.
Create a navigation obstacle to assist NPC pathfinding
If set, NPC movement will ignore this prop
Cloth scale (stretch) relative to model scale. Use to stretch (not scale) the model, e.g. to reuse a single rope model when different lengths of the rope needed.

InputOutputs.Name: Enable
InputOutputs.Description: Enable this entity.

InputOutputs.Name: Disable
InputOutputs.Description: Disable this entity.

InputOutputs.Name: StartGlowing
InputOutputs.Description: Turn on a permanent glow effect for this prop.

InputOutputs.Name: StopGlowing
InputOutputs.Description: Turn off this prop's glow effect.

InputOutputs.Name: Alpha
InputOutputs.Description: Set the sprite's alpha (0 - 255).

InputOutputs.Name: Color
InputOutputs.Description: Set the sprite's color (R G B).

InputOutputs.Name: SetDamageFilter
InputOutputs.Description: Sets the entity to use as damage filter. Pass in an empty string to clear the damage filter.

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptFile
InputOutputs.Description: Load and execute a script file

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptCode
InputOutputs.Description: Execute a fragment of script code

InputOutputs.Name: CallScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Call a script function

InputOutputs.Name: CallPrivateScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function from this entity's private script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: CallGlobalScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function in the global script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: Kill
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillHierarchy
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillConstrained
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity, all its children, and anything constrained to it, from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: AddOutput
InputOutputs.Description: Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity. Parameter format: outputname>targetname>inputname>parameter>delay>max times to fire (-1 == infinite). Very dangerous, use with care.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnKilled
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the entity is killed and removed from the game. Parameter is the inflictor.

InputOutputs.Name: Break
InputOutputs.Description: Breaks the breakable.

InputOutputs.Name: SetHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Sets a new value for the breakable's health. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: AddHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Adds health to the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: RemoveHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Removes health from the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: SetMass
InputOutputs.Description: Set mass of this object.

InputOutputs.Name: OnStartDeath
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop has begun dying (breaking) before other death-related callbacks.

InputOutputs.Name: OnBreak
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this breakable breaks.

InputOutputs.Name: OnHealthChanged
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the health of this breakable changes, passing the new value of health as a percentage of max health, from [0..1].

InputOutputs.Name: OnTakeDamage
InputOutputs.Description: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

InputOutputs.Name: Skin
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the model skin to the specified number.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow off.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow on.

InputOutputs.Name: AlternativeSorting
InputOutputs.Description: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

InputOutputs.Name: SetRenderAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Set the value of a render attribute used in material dynamic expressions. Examples: $myfloat=0.25 $myfloat4=1.0,0.0,1.0,1.0

InputOutputs.Name: ClearRenderAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Remove a render attribute previously set by SetRenderAttribute, restoring it to its previous value.

InputOutputs.Name: OnIgnite
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this object catches fire.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParent
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachment
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

InputOutputs.Name: ClearParent
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

InputOutputs.Name: FollowEntity
InputOutputs.Description: Bone merges this entity to a parent entity. Call again passing nothing to end the bone merge.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to loop. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationNoResetLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to loop unless the prop is already playing the animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetIdleAnimationLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the Idle Animation to the one specified in the parameter and force it to loop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationNotLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to not loop. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationNoResetNotLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation and force it to not loop unless the prop is already playing the animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetIdleAnimationNotLooping
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the Idle Animation to the one specified in the parameter and force it to not loop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetPlaybackRate
InputOutputs.Description: Set the playback rate for the animation.

InputOutputs.Name: SetBodyGroup
InputOutputs.Description: Sets bodygroup. Format is <BodygroupName,index>

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOn
InputOutputs.Description: Make the prop visible.

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOff
InputOutputs.Description: Make the prop invisible.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableCollision
InputOutputs.Description: Enable collision on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableCollision
InputOutputs.Description: Disable collision on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetNavIgnore
InputOutputs.Description: Enable and disable NAVIgnore on the prop.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimGraphParameter
InputOutputs.Description: Set an animation graph parameter Format: <name=value>

InputOutputs.Name: SetRagdollProfile
InputOutputs.Description: Sets the active ragdoll profile.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationBegun
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a new animation has begun playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationDone
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever an animation is complete.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationReachedEnd
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a non-looping animation playing forward hits the end (cycle=1).

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationReachedStart
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever a non-looping animation playing backward hits the beginning (cycle=0).

InputOutputs.Name: OnAnimationLoopCycleDone
InputOutputs.Description: Fires off an event when the current cycle of a looped animation is complete.

Pages.Name: prop_dynamic
Pages.Description: A prop that can be placed in hierarchy and can play animations and/or simulate cloth. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_physics (i.e. it should be physically simulated) then it CANNOT be used as a prop_dynamic. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_physics instead.

Properties.Description: Range at which the glow becomes visible. (0 = always visible)
Range at which the glow stops being visible. (0 = always visible)
Change the render color of the glow.
Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'.
The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode.
The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.
Will only be lit by lights affecting this group.
Distance at which the overlay starts to fade (<0 = subtract from fademaxdist).
Maximum distance at which the overlay is visible (0 = don't fade out).

If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, or if the engine is running under low end/medium end/XBox360, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified. This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.
If true, this geometry renders into baked cube maps
How this geometry influences baked lighting.
Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.
Name(s) of script files that are executed after all entities have spawned.
The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.
Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons.

Options.Name: Debris - Don't collide with the player or other debris
Enable motion on Physcannon grab (This also applies to the HLVR hand interaction)
Prevent motion enable on player bump
Physgun can ALWAYS pick up. No matter what.

Properties.Description: Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).
Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins.
Used to disable dynamic shadows on this entity.

Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.
The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent.
The name of the bone or attachment to attach to on the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Use !bonemerge to use bone-merge style attachment.
Offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Angular offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Scale in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Whether to respect the specified local offset when doing the initial hierarchical attachment to its parent.
The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation.

If set, this prop will randomly choose and play animations, based upon the times specified in 'Min/Max Random Anim Time'. Inbetween the random animations, it will revert to playing the 'Default Animation'.
If set, the prop will not loop its animation, but hold the last frame.
If set, this prop will randomize its cycle when it begins animating. Use this to desynchronize animating props that use the same model.
Minimum time between random animations.
Maximum time between random animations.
Enable to lag compensate this prop, should be use very sparingly!
Enable this to animate on the server in multiplayer games, such as for props with triggers parented to attachment points. Use sparingly as there is a performance cost.
Set this to allow vscript code to move the prop via SetVelocity() calls.
Only used if Scripted Movement is set, sets an initial linear velocity for the entity.
Only used if Scripted Movement is set, sets an initial rotational velocity for the entity.
Select a path_corner entity to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.
Update touches for any children that are attached to attachment points as this prop animates. This allows SetParentAttached triggers or func_brushes to touch properly.
Allow this entity to use its animgraph
Create a navigation obstacle to assist NPC pathfinding
Cloth scale (stretch) relative to model scale. Use to stretch (not scale) the model, e.g. to reuse a single rope model when different lengths of the rope needed.

InputOutputs.Name: Break

InputOutputs.Name: SetHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Sets a new value for the breakable's health. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: AddHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Adds health to the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: RemoveHealth

InputOutputs.Name: SetMass

InputOutputs.Name: OnBreak
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this breakable breaks.

InputOutputs.Name: OnHealthChanged
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the health of this breakable changes, passing the new value of health as a percentage of max health, from [0..1].

InputOutputs.Name: EnablePhyscannonPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Makes the breakable able to picked up by the physcannon.

InputOutputs.Name: DisablePhyscannonPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Makes the breakable not able to picked up by the physcannon.

InputOutputs.Name: OnTakeDamage
InputOutputs.Description: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonDetach
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the physcannon has ripped this breakable off of the wall. Only fired if ACT_PHYSCANNON_DETACH is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePreStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the Pre physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_PRE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePullStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre pull anim, this will be fired after the Pre anim has finished playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonPullAnimFinished
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop has finished playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre & Post pull anims, this will be fired after the Post anim has finished playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePostStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the Post physcannon-pull activity. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_POST activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: SetAnimationTransition
InputOutputs.Description: Force the prop to play an animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation. The second animation is the name of the animation it's transitioning from. If that one is still playing it'll just reverse from the current frame.

InputOutputs.Name: SetDefaultAnimation
InputOutputs.Description: Set the Default Animation to the one specified in the parameter.

InputOutputs.Description: Set the playback rate for the animation.
